issues_found.description: Missing React 18 initialization pattern - no code example showing how to properly initialize React 18 apps with createRoot()
issues_found.location: Patterns section - missing between Vite config and Requirements
issues_found.fix_applied: Added new 'React 18 Entry Point Pattern' section with complete examples for both browser and Electron entry points, showing createRoot() usage with Redux Provider and StrictMode wrapper

issues_found.description: Electron import paths not using process-specific aliases for better type inference
issues_found.fix_applied: Changed 'import { contextBridge, ipcRenderer } from 'electron'' to 'import { contextBridge, ipcRenderer } from 'electron/preload'' per research recommendations

issues_found.description: File handle serialization edge case identified but no solution provided
issues_found.fix_applied: Expanded edge case #3 with clear implementation guidance: file handles should NOT be stored in Redux (non-serializable), instead store only serializable metadata (fileName, content) in Redux and keep file handle references in component refs or file system abstraction layer

issues_found.description: React component example uses React.FC but research and guidance recommend inline prop typing
issues_found.fix_applied: Changed from 'export const Editor: React.FC<EditorProps> = ({ className }) =>' to 'export function Editor({ className }: EditorProps)' to match research best practices for better type inference

issues_found.description: Missing note that Electron has built-in TypeScript types - could cause confusion or unnecessary package installation
issues_found.fix_applied: Added comment: 'Note: Electron already includes TypeScript type definitions. Do NOT install @types/electron - it's unnecessary and may cause conflicts'

critique_summary: Spec was well-structured and technically sound overall, but had 5 issues ranging from high to low severity. The most critical issue was the missing React 18 initialization pattern - essential for proper implementation since React 18 changed the initialization API from ReactDOM.render() to createRoot(). Other issues included suboptimal Electron import patterns, an edge case without solution, React.FC usage inconsistency, and a missing note about Electron's built-in types. All issues have been fixed with verified changes to spec.md.
recommendations: Spec is now ready for implementation
The React 18 entry point pattern addition is critical - implementers should follow this closely
File handle management outside Redux (as clarified) will prevent serialization issues
Using 'electron/preload' imports will provide better TypeScript type inference in the Electron preload script
Future specs should include framework initialization patterns as a standard section
